uk.ac.susx.mlcl.lib
Class Comparators

java.lang.Object
  uk.ac.susx.mlcl.lib.Comparators

public final class Comparators
extends Object

A static utility class for creating, and manipulating Comparator objects.

Author:
Hamish I A Morgan <hamish.morgan@sussex.ac.uk>

Method Detail

reverse

public static <T> Comparator<T> reverse(Comparator<T> comp)
Produce a new Comparator that is identical to comp, except that the arguments are reversed. I.e compare(a,b) becomes compare(b,a). Hence, for some comparator c reverse(c).compare(a,b) = -c.compare(a,b).

Type Parameters:
T - the type of object being compared
Parameters:
comp - comparator to reverse the arguments of
Returns:
argument reversed comparator

fallback

public static <T> Comparator<T> fallback(Comparator<T> a,
                                         Comparator<T> b)
Produces a composite comparator that returns the comparison according to the first argument if non-zero, otherwise fallback to the result of the second comparator.

Type Parameters:
T - Type of object being compared
Parameters:
a - first comparator
b - second comparator, used if the first returns 0
Returns:
composite fallback comparator

fallback

naturalOrder

public static <T extends Comparable<T>> Comparator<T> naturalOrder()
Return a comparator that uses the natural ordering of the Comparable objects.

Type Parameters:
T - Type of object being compared
Returns:
comparator

naturalOrderIfPossible

public static <T> Comparator<T> naturalOrderIfPossible()
Return a comparator that uses the natural ordering of objects, which are assumed to implement Comparable. This unchecked conversion is not in the least bit safe. Probably need a better way to hand this.

Type Parameters:
T - type of object being compared
Returns:
comparator

caseInsensitiveStringComparator

public <T extends CharSequence> Comparator<T> caseInsensitiveStringComparator()
Produce a comparator that compares strings, and other CharSequence implementations, in a case-insensitive manner. Note that this is usually much faster than calling toLower on each string before comparison, and uses less memory.

Type Parameters:
T -
Returns:
